title: My Schools and Schoolmasters; Or, The Story of My Education
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: It would, however, be far from fair to regard thistransaction, which took place, I may mention, so late as the year 1829,as a specimen of the actings of either civic societies or countrylawyers. George's chief examinator on the occasion was the minister ofthe Gaelic Chapel of the place, at that time one of the Society'sCommittee for the year; and, not being a remarkably scrupulous man, heseems to have stretched a point or two, in compliance with the piouswishes and occult judgment of the Society's Secretary. But the anecdoteis not without its lesson.
